CatDescriptText: Miss Mary Lois Benton, government clerk, 6712 Rowan Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 22, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that Negroes should be 'militant' in their fight for civil rights or pursue a course of 'sitting down, talking and seeking a working plan for obtaining them without vigorous pressure?" Answer reads: "We have to have pressure, so therefore I favor a militant stand."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mary Lois Benton, wearing light colored raincoat with plaid lined collar and button down sweater with light colored patterned collar with lace trim, carrying paper package, standing in front of light colored wall, store window on left with sign inscribed "...rk", store window on right displaying female mannequins wearing various skirts and blouses
